Content:
Hello. I have a Motobi DL 125 motorcycle. I know it is a chinese one but who cares, does the job. I have a problem with it. Whenever I turn it on, even after some minutes, at around 5-6k rpm it stutters very badly. After some time, it runs perfectly. It's worth mentioning that I think the stuttering sound is coming from the box the airfilter is in. Also, I think this happens more when the weather is cold, but still I have symptoms like: poor acceleration (especially uphill), and low mileage. Could it be the airfilter? (who seems pretty clean) or the fuel system?
Also, it seems that this happens at a fixed number of rpms, thats what making me believe it could be something electrical/ECU related. What do you think? Any help is apreciated.

Title: Sputtering at 5-6k rpm and higher.
Author: Bogdandev
